bibl.title: Orphism and Christianity in Late Antiquity.

series.title: Sozomena. Studies in the Recovery of Ancient Texts.

bibl.note: Preface. - I. Introduction. - II. Orphic religious presence in the Imperial Age. - III. Fields of intersection. - IV. Orphic tradition in Christian apologetic literature - V. Christian strategies. - VI. Orphism in the light of Christian apologetics. - Appendices. Bibliography. Index locorum [see p. 422: Papyri and Inscriptions].
bibl.seg: HERRERO DE JÁUREGUI Miguel, Orphism and Christianity in Late Antiquity. (Sozomena. Studies in the Recovery of Ancient Texts. 7.)
Berlin - New York, de Gruyter, 2010, 8°, xiv-442 pp. ISBN 978-3-11-020633-3. €88.

Preface. - I. Introduction. - II. Orphic religious presence in the Imperial Age. - III. Fields of intersection. - IV. Orphic tradition in Christian apologetic literature - V. Christian strategies. - VI. Orphism in the light of Christian apologetics. - Appendices. Bibliography. Index locorum [see p. 422: Papyri and Inscriptions].

C.R. par David Konstan, CW 104 (2010-2011) pp. 379-380. - Alberto Bernabé Pajares, RFIC 139 (2011) pp. 187-190. - Benjamin Garstad, BMCRev < http://bmcr.brynmawr.edu/2010/2010-10-52.html >. - Olivier Schelske, Gnomon 85 (2013) pp. 413-419.
